title: How to implement PreOrder Traversal in Binary Tree?
content:
In pre-order traversal, each node is processed before (pre) either of it's sub-trees. This is the simplest traversal to understand. However, even though each node is processed before the subtrees, it still requires that some information must be maintained while moving down the tree.

title: What is a Tree Data Structure?
content: A tree is a data structure similar to a linked list but instead of each node pointing simply to the next node in a linear fashion, each node points to a number of nodes. A tree is an example of non-linear data structures. A Tree structure is a way of representing the hierarchical nature of a stru

title: What is a Queue?
content:
A queue is a data structure used for storing data (similar to Linked Lists and Stacks). In a queue, the order in which data arrives is important. In general, a queue is a line of people or things waiting to be served in sequential order starting at the beginning of the line or sequence.

title: What is a Stack?
content: A stack is a simple data structure used for storing data (similar to Linked Lists). In stack the order in which the data arrives is important. title: What is a Linked List?
content:
A linked list is a data structure used for storing collections of data. A linked list has the following properties.
- Successive elements are connected by pointers
- The last element points to NULL
- Can grow or shrink in size during execution of a program
